e621.description: A flavor enhancer commonly used in savory snacks and instant foods.

sodium benzoate.description: A preservative used to prevent spoilage by microbes.

cmc.description: A thickener and stabilizer used in food and pharmaceutical products.

azodicarbonamide.description: Commonly found in products like 'Classic Italian Sandwich'. Example ingredients: ITALIAN SUB ROLL (BLEACHED ENRICHED FLOUR [WHEAT FLOUR, VITAMIN A PALMITATE, CALCIUM, NIACIN, IRON, ...

carrageenan.description: Commonly found in products like 'Unsweetened Almondmilk (Fortified)'. Example ingredients: Almondmilk (water, almonds), calcium carbonate, sunflower lecithin, sea salt, potassium citrate, nat...

e211.description: Most common benzoate preservative. Effective in acidic foods.

e202.description: Most widely used sorbate preservative. Effective against molds and yeasts.

250.description: Preservative used in cured meats to prevent botulism and maintain color.

ins 282.description: Preferred preservative in baked goods as it doesn't interfere with yeast.

potassium sorbate.description: Most widely used sorbate preservative. Effective against molds and yeasts.

e250.description: Preservative used in cured meats to prevent botulism and maintain color.

citric acid.description: Found in products like: Gravy, Chyawanprash. Context: pasteurized milk, salt, citric acid, cultures of lactic acid bacteria...

ascorbic acid.description: Ascorbic acid is an organic compound with formula C6H8O6, originally called hexuronic acid. It is a white solid, but impure samples can appear yellowish.

water.description: Pure water, the most common ingredient in food products. Safe and essential for human consumption.

ins412.description: Ins412 is a food ingredient. Detailed information not available offline. Consider checking food safety databases for more details.

xanthan gum.description: Xanthan gum () is a polysaccharide with many industrial uses, including as a common food additive. It is an effective thickening agent and stabilizer that prevents ingredients from separating.

e999.description: Quillaia is the milled inner bark or small stems and branches of the soapbark (Quillaja saponaria). Other names include Murillo bark extract, Panama bark extract, Quillaia extract, Quillay bark extract, Soapbark extract, and Quillajae cortex.

ins 450.description: This is a list of all Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives episodes.

e333.description: The Nimzo-Indian Defence is a chess opening characterised by the moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2.

415.description: Year 495 (CDXCV) was a common year starting on Sunday of the Julian calendar. At the time, it was known in Rome as the Year of the Consulship of Viator without colleague (or, less frequently, year 1248 Ab urbe condita).

ins 412.description: Guar gum, also called guaran, is a galactomannan polysaccharide extracted from guar beans that has thickening and stabilizing properties useful in food, feed, and industrial applications. The guar seeds are mechanically dehusked, hydrated, milled and screened according to application.

additive_info.note: Required for product integrity and quality maintenance

ins 330.description: INS Vikramaditya (lit. 'Valour Comparable to the Sun') is a modified Kiev-class aircraft carrier and the flagship of the Indian Navy. The carrier entered into service in 2013.

additive_info.note: Required for product integrity and quality maintenance

vegetable[tomato paste(36%)].description: Chili sauce and chili paste are condiments prepared with chili peppers. Chili sauce may be hot, sweet or a combination thereof, and may differ from hot sauce in that many sweet or mild varieties exist, which is typically lacking in hot sauces.

sugar.description: Sugar is the generic name for sweet-tasting, soluble carbohydrates, many of which are used in food. Simple sugars, also called monosaccharides, include glucose, fructose, and galactose.

refined soyabean oil.description: Refined Soyabean Oil is a food ingredient. Detailed information not available offline. Consider checking food safety databases for more details.

iodised salt.description: Iodised salt (also spelled iodized salt) is table salt mixed with a minute amount of various iodine salts. The ingestion of iodine prevents iodine deficiency.

stabilizers(ins 412.description: Stabilizers and thickeners required to maintain product texture and prevent separation. This is a regulatory-approved food additive (improve texture and consistency).

additive_info.note: Required for product integrity and quality maintenance

ins 415).description: This is a list of all Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives episodes.

additive_info.note: Required for product integrity and quality maintenance

spices and condiments.description: A condiment is a preparation that is added to food, typically after cooking, to enhance the flavour, to complement the dish, or to impart a specific flavor. Such specific flavors generally add sweetness or pungency, or sharp or piquant flavors.

acidity regulator(ins 330).description: The International Numbering System for Food Additives (INS) is an international naming system for food additives, aimed at providing a short designation of what may be a lengthy actual name. It is defined by Codex Alimentarius, the international food standards organisation of the World Health Organization (WHO) and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations (UN).

additive_info.purpose: Prevent oxidation and control pH levels
additive_info.note: Required for product integrity and quality maintenance

preservative(ins 211).description: Food preservatives used to maintain product integrity and prevent bacterial/fungal growth. This is a regulatory-approved food additive (prevent spoilage and extend shelf life).

additive_info.purpose: Prevent spoilage and extend shelf life
additive_info.note: Required for product integrity and quality maintenance

It is defined by Codex Alimentarius, the international food standards organisation of the World Health Organization (WHO) and Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations (UN).

herbs(0.8%).description: Special Herbs, Vols. 9 & 0 is an instrumental album released by MF Doom under the moniker Metal Fingers.
